metadata.title: CVE-2023-6121 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: An out-of-bounds read vulnerability was found in the NVMe-oF/TCP subsystemin the Linux kernel. This issue may allow a remote attacker to send acrafted TCP packet, triggering a heap-based buffer overflow that results inkmalloc data being printed and potentially leaked to the kernel ring buffer(dmesg).

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
